Header: 12 petitions filed against the death penalty
Content: 12 fundamental rights petitions have been filed in the Supreme Court against the implementation of the death penalty. It includes the Centre for Policy Alternatives. The petitioners are seeking an interim injunction to prevent the implementation of the death penalty, a decision taken by the President to enforce the death penalty on four prisoners. They say that the death penalty is to be enforced through the Prisons Commissioner and the Welikada Prisons Superintendent. They are of the view that the implementation of the death penalty violates human rights. The petitioners are seeking an order saying that the decision concerned violates the fundamental rights of everyone, which are similar in the face of the law as mentioned in the Constitution.
